name: Corporate Fury: Capitalist Corruption Edition
description:
Corporate Fury was originally released in 2010, running at a solid 30 frames per second on first-generation iOS devices. Nearly a decade later, I released Corporate Fury: Capitalist Corruption Edition for Windows. It's completely free, as opposed to the usual free-to-play bullshit we see these days. I like to think of it as my personal hate letter to the corrupt form of global capitalism that helps enslave most of us, so please enjoy it in your spare time as you continue to throw most of your waking life away in service to a grotesque hierarchy of wealth!

The game is a labor of love, and is packed full of secrets and references, with a main loop that primarily involves fighting one-on-one matches to earn credits and claw your way up the corporate ladder. There are plenty of rough edges, this free Windows release is largely unsupported (thanks to job, health, and family distractions), and getting it working nicely with your input device of choice may require a bit of config file editing. See the included ReadMe.txt for details there.
